intro: Zygolepis rufescens, commonly known as the redstem zygolepis, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Fabaceae family, which includes legumes, and is characterized by its compound leaves and small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid environments. Its flowers are usually pink to reddish in color, and the plant produces small, pod-like fruits that contain seeds. Zygolepis rufescens is often used in xeriscaping due to its drought tolerance and ornamental value.
